actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on September 18, 2025.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Grothman moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to table the measure Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 214

actions-list.actionItem: Ms. Clark (MA) moved to table the measure.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 713 — "Censuring Representative Ilhan Omar of Minnesota and removing her from the Committee on Education and Workforce and the Committee on the Budget."

actions-list.header: QUESTION OF THE PRIVILEGES OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Ms. Mace rose to a question of the privileges of the House and offered the resolution. The Chair directed the Clerk to report the resolution. Upon examination of the resolution, the Chair determined that the resolution did constitute a question of the privileges of the House.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 245

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 5143 — "To establish standards for law enforcement officers in the District of Columbia to engage in vehicular pursuits of suspects, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 218

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 5125 — "To amend the District of Columbia Home Rule Act to terminate the District of Columbia Judicial Nomination Commission, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 216
actions-list.actionItem: 210, 1 Present (Roll no. 273).

actions-list.header: On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 213

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 722 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5371) making continuing appropriations and extensions for fiscal year 2026, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 719) honoring the life and legacy of Charles "Charlie" James Kirk; and for other purposes."
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on ordering the previous question on H. Res. 722; agreeing to H. Res. 722, if ordered; passage of H.R. 5125; and passage of H.R. 5143.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 3481 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to provide for electronic communication relating to educational assistance benefits under the laws administered by the Secretary, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 722, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 722.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 722 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5371) making continuing appropriations and extensions for fiscal year 2026, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 719) honoring the life and legacy of Charles "Charlie" James Kirk; and for other purposes."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 17.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate on H.R. 5143, the Chair put the question on passage of the bill, and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Garcia (CA) demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 5143.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4922, H.R. 5143, H.R. 5140, H.R. 5125, H.R. 1047, H.R. 3015 and H.R. 3062. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 4922, H.R. 5143, H.R. 5140, H.R. 5125, H.R. 1047, H.R. 3015, and H.R. 3062 under a closed rule, and provides for a motion to recommit on each measure.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 707. H.R. 5143 — "To establish standards for law enforcement officers in the District of Columbia to engage in vehicular pursuits of suspects, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate on H.R. 5125, the Chair put the question on passage of the bill, and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Garcia (CA) demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 5125.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4922, H.R. 5143, H.R. 5140, H.R. 5125, H.R. 1047, H.R. 3015 and H.R. 3062. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 4922, H.R. 5143, H.R. 5140, H.R. 5125, H.R. 1047, H.R. 3015, and H.R. 3062 under a closed rule, and provides for a motion to recommit on each measure.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 707. H.R. 5125 — "To amend the District of Columbia Home Rule Act to terminate the District of Columbia Judicial Nomination Commission, and for other purposes."

actions-list.header: Commission to Study the Potential Transfer of the Weitzman National Museum of American Jewish History to the Smithsonian Institution
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to Section 2(b)(4) of Public Law 118-144, the Commission to Study the Potential Transfer of the Weitzman National Museum of American Jewish History to the Smithsonian Institution Act, the Democratic Leader appointed Mr. Philip Darivoff, Short Hills, New Jersey.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 15 per side pf the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Subramanyam to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 17.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Robert J. Wittman to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
